p: Chikungunya virus (CHIKV) is a positive sense single-stranded RNA alphavirus, primarily transmitted by vectors such as mosquitoes, Aedes aegypti and Aedes albopictus.[ 1, 2] Chikungunyaâ€™s name derives from the Bantu language (Makonde ethnic group from Tanzania and Mozambique) where CHIKV was first described in 1952 and refers to a body posture showing inability to walk and debilitating joint pain.[ 3, 4] Estimates indicate that ~2 million people were reported to be infected by CHIKV during outbreaks in the 2000s.[ 5]
